org.hl7.util
Class StringUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.hl7.util.StringUtils

public class StringUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class that contains common functions dealing with strings.

Author:
Skirmantas Kligys (skirmis@hotmail.com)

matchesCmetHmdPattern

public static boolean matchesCmetHmdPattern(java.lang.String s)
Returns true if the string fits the CMET HMD or RMIM ID pattern: COCT_HDdddddd or COCT_RMdddddd, where d is a decimal digit.

Parameters:
s - string to test
Returns:
flag indicating if the string matches the pattern

searchMessageTypeFileName

public static java.lang.String searchMessageTypeFileName(java.lang.String fileDirectory,
                                                         java.lang.String messageType,
                                                         java.lang.String fileExtension)
                                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
SInce 2005 Normative Edition, the name convention is changed. It has to following HL7 v3 artifact naming convention: {UUDD_AAnnnnnnUVnn}. - UU = Sub-Section code - DD = Domain code - AA = Artifact or Document code. (Message Type will be MT) - nnnnnn = Six digit zero-filled number - UV = Universal - nn = ballot version Since the ballot version is different, starting from 01 to unknown, this function find related file by guessing the version number THIS METHOD IS NOT USED BY JAVASIG CODE ANY MORE. IF IT WERE, IT WOULD HAVE TO BE CONVERTED TO NOT USER Files BUT Resources INSTEAD. TestParseAndBuild uses it, but that's O.K. Just those tests will eventually fail.

Parameters:
fileDirectory -
messageType -
fileExtension -
Returns:
File Name
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException

matchesCmetMessagetypePattern

Returns true if the string fits the CMET message type pattern: COCT_HDdddddd or COCT_RMdddddd, where d is a decimal digit.

Parameters:

Returns:
flag indicating if the string matches the pattern

mapCmetHmdToMessageType

public static java.lang.String mapCmetHmdToMessageType(java.lang.String s)
Maps a CMET HMD ID of the form COCT_HDdddd00 or an RMIM ID of the form COCT_RMdd0000 to a message type ID of form COCT_MTdddd01, where d is a decimal digit.

Parameters:
s - the HMD or RMIM ID to convert
Returns:
conversion result: message type ID

Parameters:
s - the message type ID to convert
Returns:
conversion result: HMD ID
